_header: In the time of Arthur an aunter betide
Title(s): The Awntyrs off Arthure at the Terne Wathelyne
_description: The Awntyrs off Arthure at the Terne Wathelyne — 715 lines in 13-line alliterative stanzas (ababababcdddc).

BodDou309.First Lines:
In the Tyme of Authur an Aunter by tyddeBy ye turnen athelan as ye
                    boke telles…
BodDou309.Last Lines: …In ye tyme of ArthoreThis anter betide
BodDou309.Note:
Ninteenth-century transcript by Douce in Oxford,  Bodleian Library Douce 309 (SC 21883), f.
                    1.

BodDou324.First Lines:
IN the tyme of Arthur an aunter by tyddeBy þe turnewathelan as
                    þe boke telles…
BodDou324.Last Lines: …In þe tyme of ArthoreThis anter be tide
BodDou324.Note:
Nineteenth-century transcript by Douce in Oxford,  Bodleian Library Douce 309 (SC 21883), f.
                    1.

Lam491.First Lines:
In the tyme of Arthur an auntur bytidIn talkyng of his turmentis
                    þe tale of hym tellis…
Lam491.Last Lines:
…Thurgh a forest as y forewiþ stif knyghtis and
                    storeIn þe tyme of ArthurThis auntour
                    bytydExplicit

Lincoln91.First Lines:
In Kyng Arthure tyme ane awntir by tydeBy the Ternewahethelyne als
                    the buke tellis…
Lincoln91.Last Lines:
…This fferly byflle full sothely to sayneIn yggillwede
                    fforeste at þe Ternwathelayne
Lincoln91.Note:
One leaf missing between 157 and 158; lower outer corner of f. 159 torn
                    away, with loss of text.
Lincoln91.Attributed Title:
Here By gynnes The Awntyrs off Arthure at the Terne Wathelyn (f.
                    154)

PULTayM9.First Lines:
IN þe tyme of Arthor thys anter be tyddBe syde þe tarne
                    Wathelan as þe boke tellus…
PULTayM9.Last Lines: …In the tyme of king Arthorethis anter be tidde

Robson,  John. 
             “Three Early English Metrical Romances.” 
             Camden Society
         o.s. 18 (1842): 1-26.
